name: Clonazepam (Klonopin)
summary: A long-acting benzodiazepine used for seizure disorders, panic disorder, and certain movement disorders.
description: Clonazepam is a benzodiazepine with anticonvulsant, anxiolytic, and muscle relaxant properties. It works by enhancing the effects of GABA, the main inhibitory neurotransmitter in the CNS, leading to increased neuronal inhibition. Due to its long half-life, clonazepam is often preferred for sustained control of seizures or panic attacks but carries a risk of dependence and withdrawal symptoms with prolonged use.

items: Seizure Disorders including absence seizures, myoclonic seizures, and Lennox-Gastaut syndrome

sections.text: Clonazepam binds to the benzodiazepine site on the GABA-A receptor, increasing the frequency of chloride channel opening in response to GABA and enhancing inhibitory neurotransmission.

sections.geriatric: Start at lower end of dosing range; titrate slowly
sections.hepatic_impairment: Avoid in severe impairment; use caution otherwise

sections.text: Onset within 20–60 minutes; effects last 6–12 hours, with elimination half-life of 18–50 hours.

sections.black_box: Concomitant use with opioids may result in profound sedation, respiratory depression, coma, and death.
other: Risk of abuse, misuse, and addiction
Withdrawal reactions can be severe, including seizures
Use lowest effective dose for shortest possible duration

sections.pregnancy: Category D; potential risk to fetus; avoid unless necessary
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; may cause sedation in infant
sections.pediatrics: Use with caution; effective for some seizure disorders
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity; start low and go slow

sections.text: Reduce dose gradually over weeks to months to prevent withdrawal symptoms and seizures.

items: Preferred for panic disorder when rapid symptom control is needed
Long half-life can reduce interdose anxiety compared to shorter-acting benzodiazepines
Consider non-benzodiazepine options for long-term anxiety management
